comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Laura Hope Crews (1879-1942)--film buffs may recognize the name because she later played "Aunt Pittipat" in Gone with the Wind: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laura_Hope_Crews John Drew Jr. (1853-1927)--great-great uncle of Drew Barrymore (his sister married a Barrymore): en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Drew_Jr.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Much Ado opened with Drew and Crews around Labor Day 1913. See NYT of August 31, 1913 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9F03E2DC123FE633A...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Crews was Beatrice, Drew played Benedick. This production opened at New York's Empire Theatre on September 1, and ran for a mere 24 performances, closing the same month.

The actor John D. Barrymore was named for John Drew.
